title: Datalad publish ERROR:  stderr: 'error: RPC failed; curl 55 Failed sending data to the peer | fatal: the remote end hung up unexpectedly
body:
#### What is the problem and steps
This issue here is in the context of creating and populating a new dataset, creating a github sibling and finally publishing/pushing to github

So I create a sibling after populating my dataset. Everything is tracked so my ```datalad status``` has no output. Here it is my sibling information:

```
$ datalad siblings query -d . --url FRDR-multimodal-dataset
.: here(+) [git]
.: github(-) [https://gi114@github.com/conpdatasets/FRDR-multimodal-dataset.git (git)]
```
Therefore I want to push my changes to github
```
$ datalad publish -r --to github

[INFO   ] Publishing <Dataset path=/data/conp/FRDR-multimodal-dataset> to github 
[ERROR  ] Cmd('/usr/lib/git-annex.linux/git') failed due to: exit code(1)                                                                                                                                   
|   cmdline: /usr/lib/git-annex.linux/git -c receive.autogc=0 -c gc.auto=0 push --porcelain --progress github FRDR-dataset git-annex
|   stderr: 'error: RPC failed; curl 55 Failed sending data to the peer
| fatal: the remote end hung up unexpectedly
```

I wonder what it is going on as I cannot fix the problem. I tried to increase the http.postBuffer to 35Gb, which is just above the size of my dataset, but it did not work.

Datalad version: ```datalad 0.12.0rc2```
OS: Linux, Ubuntu 18.04

Thanks you for your help,
Giulia
